title: Report Designing — ERP
summary: Design-time metadata, tables, views, and rendering flow for a fully dynamic ERP report engine. Explains how reports are created using structured tables (sabtopleft_report_up, sabrep_topleft, sabrep_topleft_Box), dynamic view naming, mandatory fields, positioning, layout rules, and runtime execution flow inside the ERP system.
purpose: Build dynamic reports from database metadata without hard-coded layouts. Report design is stored in tables; the engine reads definitions at runtime and binds them to data using predefined SQL views.
notes: Rendering engine binds design → data using sabid and colname.
Views must follow strict naming pattern based on regcode.
All layout positions are stored in millimeters.
Lines and headings use reserved keywords (line, vline, !heading).
